climbs.name: Sound Travels from the Snow to the Dark
climbs.fa: Alex Weber and Matt Trotter (not freed yet though)

content.description:
The crux is probably between the two bulge/overhangs. Protection can be tricky, so be careful. Long and pumpy route, with some good rests if you are good at stemming and know where to look ;) This is currently the left-most route developed in Cranberry Canyon. Look for some white webbing that used to be the top of a 5.8 route, but now marks the 3/5ths point on this route.
Rap rings at the top. Standard rack up to 4". Might want to bring triples of 0.75 and 1 (BD C4s).

Crux is the finger crack. Can be done without finger locks, by using your balance and such. Fun climb :) Right most route, by a tree. You can spot the top anchors if you look close enough. Standard rack. One bolt and one piton.
Anchors at top.

climbs.name: Unnamed (The Fox Speaks to His Wife Who is Not Quite Sure (suggested))

content.description:
Looks to be down low, getting over the bulge. I have yet to climb this route... looks like it would be a 5.11 trad route. Route is in the middle of the three developed routes in the area.
Blue webbing marks the top of this route, attached to two pitons. Not sure of how good these pitons are. Hoping our friend Mat will develop this more.
The start is under the beautiful finger crack under the blue webbing. Standard rack up to 1".
Looks to take small finger-size cams and small nuts. Probably want to double or even triple up on smaller cams.

As this is in a canyon, it receives sun in the morning and then later in the afternoon is shaded and can get pretty cold (wind funneling, etc.)

Same rock as the rest of Paint Mountain: granite

Be very careful climbing in this canyon. There is significant rock fall hazards. Please be aware of other climbing parties. There is a fixed rope on the left side of the canyon to help with the steep approach. The multi pitch climbing is amazing, but the approach pitches are significantly dirty with an alpine feel. Be careful with the freeze thaw cycle as this will dislodge rocks, especially in the off-width climbs.
